text: Labor Shadow Agriculture Minister Joel Fitzgibbon said Alan Jones' controversial radio interview with Scott Morrison on drought funding gave the prime minister "the political fright of his life" - and spurred the new one-time farm household payment. "It might have made him realise he's got to stop being loose with the truth," Mr Fitzgibbon said. Mr Fitzgibbon said the new lump sum should be bigger. The Coalition announced Thursday it would give drought-affected farmers a one-off payment of up to $13,500. The one-time farm household allowance, available to residents of drought-affected areas after their four-year allotted assistance is up, equates to $7,000 for single people and $13,500 for couples.
